intro: Donella roxburghii var. tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin donella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
